item.title: Report E-2025050504
item.description:
Report E-2025050504

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-08
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:05 ET, XPO-XDM reported a 2-ounce release of CALIBRE WAREWASH DELIMER released from one 1-gallon poly jug to the cardboard box containing the jug due to a bring crushed during transit as a result of improper loading. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined they are unable to clean the spill due to hazard class 8. The product was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060039
item.description:
Report E-2025060039

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 06:18 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XDM) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to faulty packaging, approximately 8 ounces of Chem San 1400 (hazardous - UN1903) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the top area near cap and did not impact the dock floor. The caller has requested a contractor to transfer the product into a new poly drum. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed a small amount of material was observed around a drumâ€™s bung cap were loose. The bung cap in question, along with three additional drum bung caps were secured. Each drum was staken to confirm integrity and no further issues were identified.

item.title: Report E-2025050541
item.description:
Report E-2025050541

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1142 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDM. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Carquest brake cleaner released from a 5-gallon poly drum due to improper loading. The release impacted trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 20-gallon poly drum for the waste.
